tit.e: Internet-sanpai (visits to a shrine or temple on the Internet)

sen.j: インターネット参拝（インターネットさんぱい）とは、神社や寺院がホームページを作成して、パソコンの前で参拝を行うことである。
sen.e: Internet-sanpai is to pray in front of the personal computer by accessing the web site made by Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples.
Internet Sanpai is the act of visiting and praying at websites provided by Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples.
Internet Sanpai is the act of visiting and praying at websites provided by Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples.
It is also called "net-sanpai."
It is known as "net sanpai."
It is known as "net sanpai."

sen.j: 具体的には、メールで願い事を送信し、それを神職・住職が直接神前・仏前へ祈願する形式が一般的である。
sen.e: To put it concretely, it is the general style that Shinto priests and chief priests directly pray in front of the altar of shrine or temple on behalf of prayers who have already sent their wishes to the web site with e-mail.

More precisely, it generally refers to the act of Shinto priests and Buddhist priests directly praying in front of the altar of shrines or temples on behalf of people who send in their wishes and prayers via email.

More precisely, it generally refers to the act of Shinto priests and Buddhist priests directly praying in front of the altar of shrines or temples on behalf of people who send in their wishes and prayers via email.

sen.j: お札やお守りの販売も通販で行っている箇所もある。
sen.e: Some Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples also sell Ofuda (paper charm) and Omamori (a personal amulet) by mail.
Some Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples also sell Ofuda (paper charm) and Omamori (charms or amulets) over the internet.
Some Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples also sell Ofuda (paper charm) and Omamori (charms or amulets) over the Internet.

sen.j: 中にはJavaを用いて鈴を振ったり、賽銭を入れたり出来るなど本格的なものもある。
sen.e: Furthermore, some web site offer realistic services by using a program Java, through which prayers can ring a bell and make a money offering.
Some websites employ Java programs to allow worshippers to virtually see yourself ring a bell and make money offerings.

sen.e: Opinion is divided on whether Internet-sanpai is approvable or not.

sen.j: 遠方に神社があるため、直接行くことが困難な人も気軽に出来る。
sen.e: People can pray easily on the Internet, even if visiting Shinto shrine is difficult for them because the shrine is situated far away.
It makes it easier for people to visit and pray at the Shinto shrines when they are physically situated far away and difficult to reach.

sen.j: 神社が身近になり、より親近感を持ってもらえる。
sen.e: As Internet-sanpai makes people feel close to the Shinto shrine, they can feel an affinity to shrines more.
People are able to feel affinity towards the shrines since they are more easily accessible.

sen.j: 離れた箇所から神社を拝む「遙拝」、代理人に頼む「代拝」と同じである。
sen.e: Internet-sanpai is the same as 'Yohai' (offering prayers away from a shrine or temple) and 'Daihai' (offering prayers, actually done by an agent).
sen.cmt: 代拝の読み不明です。Daihaiとしました。

sen.e: The divine spirit doesn't exist on the Internet.

sen.e: The Association of Shinto Shrines unprecedentedly notified Shinto shrines nationwide that every shrine should refrain from offering an Internet-sanpai service.
